lead_paragraph: MOSLER--Sheila Hawley Sanders. The loving family of Sheila Hawley Sanders Mosler, 80, is profoundly saddened by her passing on January 4, 2016. Sheila was an incredibly loving and giving person and will be greatly missed by all who knew and loved her. Born and raised in New York City, Sheila was formerly married to John Mosler Sr., Chairman of Mosler Safe Company, mother to her sons John and Bruce, and daughter Michele. Her father was Chairman of the Hudson River Day Line and an original partner of the Circle Line. Sheila's career, which spanned more than 30 years, was focused on bridging her skills and expertise in acting between political, corporate, humanitarian and educational areas in New York City and internationally. She served as the Deputy Commissioner and Executive Lobbyist for the New York State Department of Commerce, where she was appointed by Governor Nelson Rockefeller as a corporate liaison with the top management of Fortune 500, medium sized and small businesses to maintain and bring new business to New York State. She also served as a Special Assistant and Lobbyist for the Governor's Consultant on Labor & Commissioner of Human Rights, where she acted as a bridge to the labor unions and minority grounds in New York State, as well as a Member of the Governor's Special Committee, where she was appointed as the youngest member of a special committee to review state laws and procedures in the areas of human rights and labor relations. While Sheila excelled in her professional career, she also had a place in her heart for giving back to the community. She was also a successful cabaret singer and recorded an album, "Rare! Hot!". Sheila was a graduate of Finch College and received an Honorary Doctorate of Humane Letters from St. John's University. Sheila is survived by her sons, Bruce (Wendy) Mosler and John (Jean) Mosler, her daughter Michele Mosler, and her grandchildren David and Charlotte Mosler. The wake honoring her life will take place on Thursday, January 7th from 5 to 8pm at the Frank E. Campbell Funeral Chapel and a private Mass will follow on Friday, January 8th at 9:30am at the Church of St. Vincent Ferrer. 1/3
